P071316.project_name: Coral Reef Rehabilitation and Management Program Phase II

project_abstract.cdata: This Second Coral Reef Rehabilitation and Management Project is the second phase of a fifteen-year Adaptable Program Loan (APL), a lending instrument selected because community-level interventions aimed at enhancing capacity for resource management, and changing behavior patterns from destructive to sustainable practices, require significant time and effort. The long-term objective of the project is to establish a viable, operational, and institutionalized coral reef management system in priority coral reef sites in Indonesia. The project components will: 1) support, and enhance government institutional responsiveness to meet the needs of coastal communities, through collaborative management of marine reserves, and other marine protected areas. Technical assistance will be provided to strengthen human resource development, and foster legal inputs in support of a local management of coral reefs, and associated ecosystems. Subcomponents include program coordination, monitoring and evaluation, training, coral reef research and development; and preparation of a legal and regulatory framework; 2) empower all coastal communities and institutions throughout program districts, to sustainably co-manage coral reefs, and associated ecosystems, and increase incomes, which will in turn, enhance community welfare. Its subcomponents comprise training in sustainable fishing, marketing practices, study tours, technical assistance, community-based management practices, marine conservation management, and, capacity building in the management of marine protected areas; and 3) support public awareness campaigns, education, and the sea partnership program, which will provide advisory services, provide graduate education, and create research and development responsiveness to expand program activities. The component will also foster communications, and information technology.
